body:
*Title*: `num_retries` set to 0 in the `retry_policy` still attempts a retry after a failure. 

*Description*:
The only way to completely stop retries seems to be to completely remove the `retry_policy` from the config.  This seems counter intuitive, since I would expect that setting the `num_retries` to 0 would stop the server from doing a retry.  None of the docs seem to indicate this caveat that i've seen (https://www.envoyproxy.io/docs/envoy/latest/configuration/http/http_filters/router_filter#config-http-filters-router-x-envoy-max-retries)

*Repro steps*:
- binary extracted from Envoyproxy v1.12.2 from Dockerhub
- bootstrap config provided below
- and no local service at the configured cluster

1. w/ a retry policy and num_retries=3, you will see the initial request + 3 retry attempts
2. w/ a retry policy and num_retries=1, you will see the initial request + 1 retry
3. w/ a retry policy and num_retries=0, you will again see the initial request + 1 retry
4. w/ no retry policy, only the initial request is seen.  No retry is attempted.  

Logs (with connection logging set to debug to see the retries)
### Config as above, `curl localhost:10000`
```bash
[2020-01-03 12:35:49.914][24240][debug][connection] [source/common/network/connection_impl.cc:711] [C2] connecting to 127.0.0.1:443
[2020-01-03 12:35:49.914][24240][debug][connection] [source/common/network/connection_impl.cc:720] [C2] connection in progress
[2020-01-03 12:35:49.914][24240][debug][connection] [source/common/network/connection_impl.cc:568] [C2] delayed connection error: 111
[2020-01-03 12:35:49.914][24240][debug][connection] [source/common/network/connection_impl.cc:193] [C2] closing socket: 0
```

*Config*:
```yaml
admin:
  access_log_path: /tmp/admin_access.log
  address:
    socket_address:
      protocol: TCP
      address: 127.0.0.1
      port_value: 9901
static_resources:
  listeners:
  - name: listener_0
    address:
      socket_address:
        protocol: TCP
        address: 0.0.0.0
        port_value: 10000
    filter_chains:
    - filters:
      - name: envoy.http_connection_manager
        typed_config:
          "@type": type.googleapis.com/envoy.config.filter.network.http_connection_manager.v2.HttpConnectionManager
          stat_prefix: ingress_http
          route_config:
            name: local_route
            virtual_hosts:
            - name: local_service
              domains: ["*"]
              routes:
              - match:
                  prefix: "/"
                route:
                  cluster: service
                  retry_policy:
                    num_retries: 3
                    retry_on: 5xx
          http_filters:
          - name: envoy.router
  clusters:
  - name: service
    connect_timeout: 0.25s
    type: LOGICAL_DNS
    # Comment out the following line to test on v6 networks
    dns_lookup_family: V4_ONLY
    lb_policy: ROUND_ROBIN
    load_assignment:
      cluster_name: service
      endpoints:
      - lb_endpoints:
        - endpoint:
            address:
              socket_address:
                address: localhost
                port_value: 443
```

title: num_retries of 0 still attempts a retry
